On the third representation of the New

GftAND DRAMATIC ORATORIO,

The Theatre overflowed in every part immediately after the opening of the Doors : and the whole Performance was received with
an enthusiasm wholly unexampled. The Public is therefore respectfully informed that this

Splendid Novel Performance
will be repeated

most respectfully beg leave to announce to the Public, that the Lessee bavin'"suddenly terminated his Season at an unprecedentedly early period, they have"
upon an application unanimously made, received a License to continue their
Performances until the usual number of nights shall have been completed.

M SCHROEDER DEVRIENT

In FIDELIO, she will repeat her celebrated Character of LEONORA,
this Evening ; and the Grand Opera of EURYANTHE is therefore postponed until Friday next.

will appear in her popular Character of the PAGE, In JOHN of PARIS.

T h e Public is respectfully informed, that in consequence of the unprecedented Popularity
creased Attraction of Mr. S H E R I D A N K N O W L E S s N e w Play of

THE

WIFE: A TALE

and in-

OF MANTUA,

and in compliance with the continued demand for Places to witness its representation, it will be

T TTHVHFW S'

DIAVOLO.

Was performed on Monday, for the 35th successive Night,
and while Public Opiniou has pronounced it to be one of the
most Splendid Dramas ever produced on the English Stage,
that Opinion has been confirmed by the largest Receipts ever
taken for such a continued Periou, and particularly at this
Season of the Year. The Lessee has, therefore, the honor
of announcing that its Performance will be resumed on
Monday next; previous to which Evening, the Scenery,
Dresses, and Decorations, will be entirely renovated, in
order that the numerous Families now coming to Town may
have an opportunity of seeing it in all its original Splendour.

COURTSHIP

GUSTAVO'S THE THIRD,

Wits performed last Evening for the 35th successive Night,
and while Public Opinion has pronounced it to be one ol the
most Splendid Dramas ever produced on the English Stage,
that Opinion has been confirmed by the largest Receipts ever
taken for such a continued Period, and particularly at this
Season of the Year. The Lessee has, therefore, the honor
of announcing that its Performance will be resumed on
Monday next; previous to which Evening, the Scenery,
Dresses, and Decorations, will be entirely renovated, in
order that the numerous Families now coming to Town may
have an opportunity of seeing it in all its original Splendour.

Crii5>'*"Avus T H E THIRD,

Was Derformed on Monday, for the 85th successive Night,
and while Public Opinion has pronounced ittobe one of the
most Splendid Dramas ever produced on the English Stage,
that Opinion has been confirmed by the largest Receipts ever
taken for such a continued Period, and particularly at this
Season of the Year. The Lessee has, therefore, the hoote*
Sr announcing that its Performance will be resumed on
Monday next; previous to which Evening, the Scenery,
Dresses, and Decorations, will be entirely renovated, in
order that the numerous Families now comingtoTown may
have an opportunity of seeing it in all its original Splendour.
